member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.DeviceStatus.Bug
member.summary: There is a bug in the code

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.SendPacketStatus.SendInitiated
member.summary: The operation of sending the packet is initiate. The packet still waits in the queue.

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.SendPacketStatus.SendACKed
member.summary: The operation of sending the packet is unsuccessful. The packet is dropped from the queue with successful status.

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.SendPacketStatus.SendNACKed
member.summary: The operation of sending the packet is unsuccessful. The packet still waits in the queue.

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.SendPacketStatus.SendFailed
member.summary: Send Permenantly Failed. The packet is dropped from the queue with unsuccessful status.

member.param: Number of times to try resending packet
Time (in milliseconds) to check for clear channel
Timeout (in milliseconds) to declare neighbor dead

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.MAC.AddressType.Broadcast
member.summary:
Indicates destination is all nodes in range.
Other values indicate a particular node.

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.MAC.Link.AverageRSSI
member.summary: Average Received Signal Strength Indication, RSSI.
member.remarks: Exponentially smoothed (with lambda of 0.2) average of SINR code as reported by the radio. For RF231 has conversion (-91 + AvgRSSI) provides the true value. For SI radio the conversion is already done at the driver and is cast into uint. Hence the conversion to get signed value is -1*( (0xFF - AvgRSSI)+1 ).

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.MAC.Link.LinkQuality
member.remarks: As reported by the radio. For RF231, represent a measure of the BER for the corresponding SINR. For SI radio, not available. Hence a value of 0 is reported. Exponentially smoothed with lambda of 0.2.

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.MAC.Link.AverageDelay
member.remarks: Has units of 65.535 (=10^3/(2^19/2^8)) ms. Exponentially smoothed

members.member: Since a sender will not have the link details when sending a packet, the receiver has to send back the details (such as RSSI, LQI) to the sender (by piggybacking on a data packet for instance).

member.name: F:Samraksh.eMote.Net.MAC.Neighbor.ReceiveLink
member.summary: Receive (formerly reverse) link details between current and neighbor node. Provides link details of receptions from a certain neighbor. A received packet's metadata carries details such as RSSI and LQI.

member.summary: Set the address of the device
member.remarks: This is the address by which the device is known to the rest of the world. A return value of false can occur if another layer locks the address and prevents changes.

member.summary: Load the packet into the transmit buffer of the radio

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.SendTimeStamped(System.Byte,System.Byte[],System.UInt16,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Load and send a time-stamped packet, with specified time stamp
member.remarks: The offset for the timestamp in the packet is specified by TimeStampOffset member of the RadioConfiguration structure passed as parameter during radio module initialization.
member.returns: The result of the method: E_RadioInit, E_RadioSync, E_RadioConfig, E_MacInit, E_MacConfig, E_MacSendError, E_MacBufferFull, S_Success
